intro: Chrysosplenium pilosum var. barbatum, commonly known as the hairy chrysosplenium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant features dense, hairy foliage that gives it a soft, textured appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental ground cover.
